headline.main: Charities That Inspire Kids: The Family & Youth Initiative

docs.abstract: Teenagers in foster care need the meaningful connections with adult friends and mentors that this organization provides. Sometimes those relationships become something more.
docs.snippet: Teenagers in foster care need the meaningful connections with adult friends and mentors that this organization provides. Sometimes those relationships become something more.

docs.lead_paragraph: More than half of Americans say they already have enough information at restaurants to decide whether they are making a healthy purchase. But they want even more.

headline.main: AP-GfK Poll: Americans Support Menu Labeling
headline.print_headline: AP-GfK Poll: Americans Support Menu Labeling

docs.snippet: More than half of Americans say they already have enough information at restaurants to decide whether they are making a healthy purchase. But they want even more.

docs.lead_paragraph: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) was partially responsible for the scale of the Ebola crisis in three West African countries as its policies hampered healthcare spending in these post-conflict states, according to a new study.

headline.main: IMF Focus on Cutting Debt Over Health Spending Worsened Ebola in Africa-Study
headline.print_headline: IMF Focus on Cutting Debt Over Health Spending Worsened Ebola in Africa-Study

docs.snippet: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) was partially responsible for the scale of the Ebola crisis in three West African countries as its policies hampered healthcare spending in these post-conflict states, according to a new study.

docs.lead_paragraph: Readers, including nutritionists and the Sugar Association, respond to an Op-Ed essay calling sugar addictive.

headline.main: Are We Really Eating Too Much Sugar?
headline.print_headline: Are We Really Eating Too Much Sugar?

docs.snippet: Readers, including nutritionists and the Sugar Association, respond to an Op-Ed essay calling sugar addictive.

docs.lead_paragraph: A Florida equestrian center where 22 horses were poisoned by tainted feed has reached a settlement with the company that produced and sold the feed.

headline.main: Settlement Reached in Horse Deaths Caused by Tainted Feed
headline.print_headline: Settlement Reached in Horse Deaths Caused by Tainted Feed

docs.snippet: A Florida equestrian center where 22 horses were poisoned by tainted feed has reached a settlement with the company that produced and sold the feed.

docs.lead_paragraph: The United Nations said on Monday it had begun delivering food aid to war-torn South Sudan via the Nile River from Sudan for the first time since it became independent in 2011, warning the country could face a "hunger catastrophe".

headline.main: U.N. Reopens Nile Route to Bring Aid to Hunger-Hit South Sudan
headline.print_headline: U.N. Reopens Nile Route to Bring Aid to Hunger-Hit South Sudan

docs.snippet: The United Nations said on Monday it had begun delivering food aid to war-torn South Sudan via the Nile River from Sudan for the first time since it became independent in 2011, warning the country could face a "hunger catastrophe".
